required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Homeopathic Medication and Nutritional Oriented Diet to Treat Overweight Pregnant Women With Mental Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: Homeopathic Treatment in Pregnant Women With Overweight and Mental Disorder: a Double Blinded Controlled Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of homeopathic treatment in pregnant women with overweight and class I obesity with suspicion of a mental disorder.

detailed_description.textblock: The weight gain during pregnancy has been reported as an important factor of being overweight after delivery and comorbidities. There are a lot of restrictions to treat pregnant women due to fetus development. Homeopathy presents itself as an integrative medicine that could treat with less collateral effects improving general health. The investigators are going to test the effects of homeopathy.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

arm_group.description: Nutritional oriented diet for pregnancy period add homeopathic preparation from inert substance.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Nutr and Homeop Sulph Puls Lyc Lackt Con Sep Nuxv Calcc Phos
arm_group.description: Nutrition oriented diet for pregnancy period add active homeopathic medication (Sulph, Puls, Lyc, Lack t, Con, Sep, Nux v, Calc c, Phos)

intervention.intervention_name: Sulph, Puls, Lyc, Lack t, Con, Sep, Nux v, Calc c, Phos
intervention.description: CH 12 preparation, 6 drops, twice a day, 4 days per week, until the end of pregnancy. One medication per appointment.
intervention.arm_group_label: Nutr and Homeop Sulph Puls Lyc Lackt Con Sep Nuxv Calcc Phos

intervention.description: Homeopathy 6 drops twice a day 4 days per week, active and placebo and Balanced nutritional oriented diet for both groups.
intervention.arm_group_label: Nutr and Homeop Sulph Puls Lyc Lackt Con Sep Nuxv Calcc Phos

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women with less than 28 weeks,
- BMI from 26 to 35 Kg/ m2,
- SRQ-20 positive.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diabetes
- Cardiopathies
- Hypertension
- Nephropathies
- Psychiatric treatment
- Drug users
- Pulmonary Chronic Disease
- Suicidal ideas
- No eating (appetites)
- Problems of BMI measurements (disabled people)
- Concomitant homeopathic treatment
- People who are looking for just 1 medical appointment

overall_official.affiliation: Medicine School - University of São Paulo
